Name: Integration Patterns and Practices
Description__c:
This document is for designers and architects who need to integrate the Lightning Platform with other applications in their enterprise.
This content is a distillation of many successful implementations by Salesforce architects and partners.
Read the pattern summary and selection matrix if you’re considering large-scale adoption of Salesforce-based applications (or the
Lightning Platform) to become familiar with the integration capabilities and options available. Architects and developers should consider
these pattern details and best practices during the design and implementation phase of a Salesforce integration project.
If implemented properly, these patterns enable you to get to production as fast as possible and have the most stable, scalable, and
maintenance-free set of applications possible. Salesforce’s own consulting architects use these patterns as reference points during
architectural reviews and are actively engaged in maintaining and improving them.
As with all patterns, this content covers most integration scenarios, but not all. While Salesforce allows for user interface (UI)
integration—mashups, for example—such integration is outside the scope of this document. If you feel that your requirements are
outside the bounds of what these patterns describe, speak with your Salesforce representative.

Name: Platform Pillar Owner Program (Platform POP)
Description__c: The Platform Pillar Owner Program is a collaboration between the Platform Solution Engineering and Platform Product Management organizations. Platform SE's are assigned ownership over Pillars that align to Platform services or technology areas. The Platform SE's help PM's scale knowledge to the broader PSE organization by coordinating monthly calls, a Product Strategy Review (PSR) before each major release, and arranging their section on the by-release Product Council.

Name: Flow Demo - Multi-step Import Flow
Description__c: Recently I worked on a demo that involved building an Invokable Flow to process a set of data uploaded into a queue table (called Fileback). I doubt this exact use case will match perfectly for what your customers ask for, but if you'd like to see a flow in action that loops through a queue, and validates data against standard objects and updates the queue status accordingly, this may be the flow for you!
Source__c: Jonathan's Demo he built with Lori

Name: Salesforce Architect Journey - Trailhead
Description__c:
Salesforce architect credentials comprise three tiers of certification that recognize specialized knowledge and skills, as well as your growing expertise in the Salesforce platform:
The Salesforce Architecture Designer credentials validate knowledge and expertise in particular specializations.
The Salesforce Application Architect and System Architect certifications recognize professionals who possess expertise in a domain area.
The Salesforce Technical Architect (CTA) credential is the pinnacle certification for those who demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and capabilities to design and build high-performance technical solutions on the Salesforce platform across all areas of domain expertise.

Name: Solutions Hub - Amer Commercial (+Asset Search)
Description__c: The AMER Commercial Solutions Hub is a collection of resources that we've curated to help you team better, grow your career, and stay updated with what's happening in our organization. As the most trusted, innovative, and engaged Solutions team, we inspire, transform, and ensure the success of our customers with high-value solutions. The resources in this Hub help us align our daily work to our Vision and Values. We hope that this will become your "go-to" resource for all things Commercial Solutions related. Thank you for visiting!

Name: Solutions Central
Description__c: *Solutions Central* (https://solutionscentral.io/) (formerly the Demo Center) is the global, central, content repository for Salesforce where you can find community-sourced content, industry and product content, demo tools and support, demo tips and tricks, design assets, and more. The content is primarily sourced by the Solutions Engineering org and was visited by over 16,000 employees in FY19.

Name: Designing Lightning Pages for Scale
Description__c: This blog post provides guidance to architects, developers, and administrators in creating and designing Lightning pages that scale and perform well. Where we used to have Visualforce and multi-page applications, we now have Lightning Web Components (LWC) and single-page (single page) applications (SPA).

Name: Integration and Architecture Designer Certification - Study Guide
FY21 Platform SKUs Onion Slides
Description__c:
SKU-at-a-glance slides have a lot of complexity, and may not be current with new SKUs and license names. This refreshed look & data were a summer 2019 project of the CBU Platform Technical Services Futureforce Intern, Charles Wolloch.
Use these new slides as a conversational tool to clarify which license includes what kind of object access. Note that they are approximate, not a source of truth; please refer to the User License Comparison to resolve confusion.
Bundle SKUs (Employee Experience) are not reflected in these slides. The slides reflect EE/UE configurations and do not include PE or Essentials.
These slides will evolve and change over time, so please refer back to this master (copy with links in Google Slides) to make sure your view stays up to date.
Questions? Email Mike Rose.
